title: Marcelo Ortiz M.
text:
I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Economics and Business at Universitat Pompeu Fabra.
My research focuses on three main areas: Accounting, Corporate Governance, and Business Families.
I’m fortunate that my research has been published in leading finance and management journals such as The Review of Financial Studies, Entrepreneurship Theory and Practice, and Global Strategy Journal.
Also, I’m an Affiliated Professor at the Barcelona School of Economics and the Barcelona School of Management, and have been a visiting scholar at Université Paris Dauphine-PSL and Rotterdam School of Management.
I co-organize the Barcelona Accounting Summer Seminars and Workshops.
My CV is available here.

title: About
text:
I grew up in Chile, specifically between Viña del Mar and Santiago, an area renowned for its beautiful valleys, snowy mountains, and stunning coastline.
I completed all my degrees at Universidad Adolfo Ibañez, starting with an undergraduate degree in industrial engineering, followed by a Master of Science in financial engineering, and then a PhD in Finance. When I wasn’t studying, I spent most of my weekends engaged in water sports, hiking, and photography. Below are some of my pictures from Chile!
I moved to the Netherlands in 2018 as a visiting PhD student at Erasmus University. In 2019, I started working at Universitat Pompeu Fabra.
Before starting my PhD, I worked as a financial trader for five years, handling interest and liquidity risk exposure in Itau Bank (formerly “Corpbanca”).
